front.title: RPKI Publication Server Best Current Practices

abstract.t: This document describes best current practices for operating an RFC 8181 RPKI Publication Server and its rsync and RRDP (RFC 8182) public repositories.

section.name: Requirements notation
section.t: The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "NOT RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as described in BCP 14 when, and only when, they appear in all capitals, as shown here.

section.name: Introduction
section.t: describes the RPKI Publication Protocol that is used between RPKI Certificate Authorities (CAs) and their Publication Repository server. The server is responsible for handling publication requests sent by the CAs, called Publishers in this context, and ensuring that their data is made available to RPKI Relying Parties (RPs) in in public rsync and RRDP publication points.
In this document we will describe best current practices based on the operational experience of several implementers and operators.
